definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
opera for popular in Sichuan and Yunnan

sentences.english: The audiences enjoyed the moon and the lanterns while solving the riddles in a relaxed way.
sentences.chinese: 中秋夜人们将谜条张贴在各种花灯之上，赏月猜谜。

sentences.english: You can see light displays from many different countries.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到来自不同国家的花灯展示。

sentences.english: However, I particularly like my little ladybug lantern.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我还是特别喜欢我的小瓢虫花灯。

sentences.english: Hong Kong holds the record for the largest dragon lantern.
sentences.chinese: 香港保持住最巨型的龙形花灯的记录。

sentences.english: Here there were large, specially designed lanterns made a wide range of design, novelty.
sentences.chinese: 这里人山人海，花灯种类繁多，设计新奇，造型各异。

sentences.english: The traditions of viewing decorative lanterns on this night began more than two thousand years ago in the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 元宵夜观花灯的习俗开始于两千多年前的西汉时期。

sentences.english: This day's important activity is watching lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节的重要活动是赏花灯。

sentences.english: QinQiong in the street walk while viewing lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 秦琼在街上边走边观赏花灯。

sentences.english: If visitors have right solutions to the riddles, they will get a little gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果赏花灯的人猜中谜底，就会得到小礼物。

sentences.english: Solving riddles on lanterns has been a popular tradition since the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 正月十五赏花灯是元宵节必有的另一项习俗。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, children go out at night carrying lanterns with much pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚上，孩子们提着花灯高高兴兴地在街上游玩。

sentences.english: Today, the displaying of lanterns is still a big event on the 15th day of the first lunar month throughout China.
sentences.chinese: 正月15挂花灯在华夏大地仍一项很隆重盛大的活动。

sentences.english: Performances were staged in the region, which is known for its decorative lantern craft.
sentences.chinese: 演出是在弥渡地区举行，这是它的花灯工艺闻名。

sentences.english: At seven o'clock, we came to the Confucius Temple lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 七点刚过，我们就来到夫子庙看花灯。

sentences.english: Xiushan festive lantern is a state-level intangible cultural heritage.
sentences.chinese: 秀山花灯是国家级非物质文化遗产。

sentences.english: They go there to see giant lanterns and play quizzes.
sentences.chinese: 他们去那里看大型花灯还有猜灯谜。

definition: carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
riddles written on lanterns (e.g. for the Lantern Festival at the end of Chinese New Year)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
festival entertainment (lion dance, dragon lantern etc)
to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)
